Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Let the buyer beware.

Dialogue: You got a leak in the number nine compartment.

Dialogue: With that coxswain dickhead.

Dialogue: What a laugh.

Dialogue: You, shut up.

Dialogue: Uh-uh. No. We're gonna fix this right now.

Dialogue: What seems to be the trouble, ladies?

Dialogue: Whyn't you mind your own business, chief.

Dialogue: As I said, what seems to be the trouble?

Dialogue: Didn't you hear me, grandpa? Or you got your hearing aid turned down?

Dialogue: I heard you. But I'm choosing to ignore you. Epps, let's go.

Dialogue: These ladies was having themselves a discussion and you're interrupting it.

Dialogue: Show your tatoos to that coxswain last night, did you Epps?

Dialogue: I bet you did.

Dialogue: Candy?

Dialogue: Red sky in morning, sailor take warning.

Dialogue: Why not.

Dialogue: There's a large vessel out about ten miles to the north-west.

Dialogue: Alright. I'll be right up.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: This is tugboat Arctic Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Over.

Dialogue: Merchant vessel at one seven four one five west, five seven seven five north, this is tugboat Arctic Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Over.

Dialogue: Too deep to anchor out there.

Dialogue: Looks like it's adrift.

Dialogue: Could be a fishing boat.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Too big. More like a freighter.

Dialogue: What the hell would a freighter be doing up here? It's way out of the lanes. There's not a port for 800 miles.

Dialogue: Smugglers maybe.

Dialogue: Smuggling what? Tundra grass?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Merchant vessel at position one seven four one five west, five seven seven five north, this is tugboat Arctic Warrior. Do you copy? Over.

Dialogue: Call the Coastguard?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Steer to one eight five. Let's check her out.

Dialogue: Alright. Back it off.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hit the lights.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: "Chimera."

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Chimera.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Chimera, I am hove to at your port bow. Is there anyone aboard?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Epps, come with me. You guys sit tight.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Talk to me, skipper.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We're in a stairwell just under the main superstructure.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: This is definitely an old boat, maybe sixty years old. She hasn't been in service for at least twenty years. Probably a lot longer.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's funny.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: How's that?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Besides a little rust, everything's pretty well-preserved.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How she got out here is one hell of a good question.  Jesus.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Murphy.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Murphy, goddamit.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's a passenger ship. It's a damn passenger ship.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There's nobody on that boat.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Probably slipped her moorings, got tangled up in a current.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Out here? What, so a seven hundred foot passenger liner drifted out of Spokane harbor and nobody managed to bump into her until now?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Somebody's probably looking for her as we speak.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Whatever the reason, she's adrift and abandoned. We've got every right to salvage her.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: You mean tow her back? That's a thirty thousand ton ship you're talking about.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We've done it before.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, from one side of the harbor to the other. But we got half the Bering Sea and the whole Alaskan gulf to drag her over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You have any idea how much a ship like that could be worth in salvage? The fittings alone could go for a few million.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: If you get it back in one piece.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's a risk I'm willing to take.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: All we got to do is hit some rough weather and you can forget about it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: So we cut her loose and wait it out. A little weather couldn't be anything she hasn't seen before.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: It's a bloody navigation hazard. One boat can't control a ship that size.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The damn thing's been floating around for God knows how long and it hasn't hit anything yet. So we take it easy. A little of the old push pull.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Listen. Forget this job's just a pay check for a minute. You know I've been good to you. But I'm prepared to offer you something better now.  If we do this right, it's worth a lot of money. A lot of money.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Salvage fees on a vessel like this could come in around four million bucks. At least. Who knows, could be more. Could be a lot more.  What I'm proposing is... we split it four ways.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Think about it. A million bucks a piece.  You want to spend the rest of your days drag-assing tank barges on the gulf coast, fine. Otherwise, let's get to work.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard. This is tugboat Arctic Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Over.

Dialogue: North Island, I wish to declare myself salvor-in-posession under section four two charlie of the International Maritime Convention.

Dialogue: A passenger liner. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: A passenger liner, north island. Over.

Dialogue: Passenger vessel "Chimera." I will spell: charlie hotel india mary echo romeo alpha. No registry information is available at this time. I have determined to the best of my ability that the vessel has been abandoned on the high seas at position one seven four west, five seven north at...  Two zero one four hours zulu time. Over.

Dialogue: Supposing one of those cables breaks under tow.

Dialogue: Then we'll all be doomed. Any other questions?

Dialogue: Ready?

Dialogue: Bring it on, dude.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: OK.

Dialogue: Dodge? You alright?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Alright, skipper, real easy.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Steady as she goes.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Throttle back.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: More.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: More.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Right there, skipper. Right there.

Dialogue: With a little extra fuel, weather permitting, we should make Sitka in five days without another stop.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Sounds reasonable.

Dialogue: Hypothetically speaking, what if we get this boat to Sitka and find out somebody wants it back?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: They shoulda thought of that when they let her float away.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I don't care what, ain't nobody just gonna let us walk away with a ship that size.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The law's on our side. If they want to challenge it, let them try.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: They must've scuttled it. Nobody just lets a ship float away.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Nobody just scuttles a passenger liner either.

Dialogue: Ever heard of insurance, big boy?

Dialogue: Either way, we found it. It's ours now -- .

Dialogue: What the...

Dialogue: ALL STOP! ALL STOP!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Mother fucker!

Dialogue: What is it?

Dialogue: Threw a turbine blade.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Son of a bitch!

Dialogue: The number one turbine's pretty well trashed. Number two runs, but it's way underpowered.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How long to fix?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Hard to say. I gotta get in there and have a look. At least a couple days. Depending.

Dialogue: You think the extra strain caused it?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Nah. Everything was cool. It's just one of those things.

Dialogue: Some classy tub in it's day, huh?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: One first class passage. Elizabeth James. Dubayy to Halifax. January

Dialogue: Chimera. Flag ship of the Dobbins Kirk Line. Nova Scotia.

Dialogue: I'd sure like to get my hands on the general log.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: That must be the old man right there.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Looks like one hell of a stick up his ass.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: He'd let you off at the nearest port, that's for sure.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: How about now?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Sixty pounds.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What? You sure?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: That's what it says.

Dialogue: Lemme see.

Dialogue: Coffee?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Yeah. Thanks.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What'd you find up there?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Some charts. A crew manifest.  Looks like her last voyage was January 1953. The question is where the hell's she been since.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: She was sailing up north, right?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Her destination was Halifax, yeah.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Well, suppose she got a little further north than she should have.  Got stuck in the ice. The passengers and crew evacuated. She froze into the ice pack, which moved further north, where it froze in solid. They write it off. Fifty years later, the whole global warming thing happens. The ice melts, she gets loose and floats around til somebody runs into her.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: As reasonable an explanation as any, I guess.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Ever heard of the Mary Celeste?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: She was a two-masted brig boat sailing out of New York in 1872.  One day she was sighted off the coast of Portugal by a merchant vessel, the Dei Gratia. As the crew of the Dei Gratia got closer, they discovered that no one was at the helm of the Mary Celeste. On boarding, they found her completely deserted. The captain, his wife, their daughter, and the entire crew, all gone. The last entry in their log made no mention of any trouble. The table was even set for dinner. And in the nine days after the last entry, she sailed 700 miles without anyone aboard.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: So what did happen?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Nobody knows. There've been a lot of theories, of course. But we'll never really know for sure.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You think she's sailing without a crew?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I think we'd be surprised where a drifting ship might wind up with a little wind and the right current.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You're more practical than superstitious.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Only way to be.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Turbine rotor's shot.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I thought you said it was just a blade.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Metal's crystallized. Gotta replace the whole deal.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How much longer's that gonna take?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Like I always say --

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I know I know, two ways to do anything --

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: The right way and the wrong way.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: But how long?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Hard to say.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We gotta get outa here, Dodge. A storm blows up and we're history.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I'm telling you, you don't want to be running that fan like it is.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What about running number two by itself?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: It's a full 2500 horses down. We couldn't drag that boat down hill on ice with it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How long, then?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I gotta pull the blades and re-seat everything in a new rotor -- .

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Three, four days.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Goddamit, Dodge.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What do you want me to tell you, that we can throw this sucker back in and start pulling her like nothing happened? Can't do it, skipper.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: North Island, North Island, North Island. This is tugboat Arctic Warrior. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: North Island, please repeat? Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: North Island, have you got any additional information? Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Roger, North Island. I am tied to the passenger vessel Chimera. And she is afloat. Repeat, she is afloat. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Roger, North Island. Please advise pending further information. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Obviously it's some kind of screw up. The shipping records aren't a hundred percent accurate.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Man, it gives me the creeps. We got no business towing a ship that size anyway. I say we fix the turbines and hit the highway.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Are you crazy? Do you realize we got ourselves a ship? We own a ship, Dodge.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, a ship that's supposed to have been lost at sea fifty years ago. You don't think that's just a little freaky?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: If this thing turns out to be a ship everybody thought sank a long time ago, we just hit the jackpot.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, well how the hell you get something like that wrong? That's a damn big boat. It's either sunk or it ain't.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We all want to get outa here, Dodge. Especially me. With that boat in tow. You got three days.  Make the most of it.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Fucker!

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Take it easy, Dodge. It's only a piece of metal.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Damn mind of it's own.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Morning, skipper.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Morning.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: You're up late.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Guess I must've fallen back to sleep. Where's Epps?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Went aboard.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: She take a radio?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What the fuck you think we gonna do with it? It's ours, baby. It's all ours.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: How much you figure that's worth, skipper?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hard to say. Maybe forty, fifty million.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Ho, baby!

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: That's a lot of money for somebody to just let float away.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Yes, it is.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's a hell of a lot of money.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What, you think there's something funny about it?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: A ship with fifty million dollars in gold aboard, adrift? And nobody seems to care enough to come looking for it?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: If they thought it was lost at sea, they probably just wrote it off.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Not for fifty million. An ocean liner maybe. But fifty million in gold, they come looking for.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe they didn't want it back. Maybe the whole fat deal was insured.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Maybe. But there's always somebody whose interest's at stake.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: All I gotta say is it looks like that somebody's us right now.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: And it looks like somebody got here before us too.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Didn't happen yesterday, I'll tell you that. Torn parts rusted bad as the rest of the boat.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Then it happened before they scuttled her.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You mean, before she sank.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Cargo like this could make a crew think twice.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That it could.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Then why didn't they take it.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Probably didn't have time.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Or somebody stopped them.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Either way, they must've had a pretty good reason.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Must be a damn good reason to jump ship and leave fifty million dollars aboard.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: So what're we gonna do. That's the big question, right?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: A salvage claim to a vessel's cargo's as valid as a claim to the vessel itself. It's ours.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Then we're rich. We're damn, filthy stinking rich.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It looks like it.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: So what? We gonna unload the gold and get a move on?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We leave it where it is. Stick to the plan.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: You gotta be kidding? What the hell we need that tub for, we got fifty million bucks?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: So we get a little more for the boat. Besides, the gold'll be safer where it is.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Yeah, but we still gotta haul that big piece of shit all the way back to Sitka.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's worth the effort. Believe me. Besides we're gonna need her to prove the salvage.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Why not call for help?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: For now the best thing we can do is to keep quiet about this.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Last thing we want is extra partners.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Or uninvited guests.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I heard that.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dodge, you gotta get on those repairs.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. I'm on it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The sooner we get under way, the sooner we are to spending what's ours.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Two hundred twenty. Two twenty one.  Two twenty two.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Two hundred twenty two kilograms of solid gold.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: That's what I call a payday.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Hell yeah.

Dialogue: Murphy!

Dialogue: Propane tanks're gonna go!

Dialogue: Looks like it took out the backup genny too.

Dialogue: Terrific.

Dialogue: What now?

Dialogue: We could call for help.

Dialogue: And get a bunch of fools sniffin' around here?

Dialogue: I tell you one thing, we're not gonna be towing no ship now.

Dialogue: Not much at all, I guess. Retire. Live out my golden years and all that.

Dialogue: How about you Epps?

Dialogue: Guess I'll just keep working.

Dialogue: What's so great about Sweden?

Dialogue: It's a beautiful country. Very clean. Very civilized. And cold.

Dialogue: Hell, yeah. I like it cold. Colder the better.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Did you see him?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: The guy. He just came this way.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What guy?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: There's somebody else on this boat.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What? What the hell're you talking about.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I saw him. Just a minute ago. Some guy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Of course I'm sure. I saw him.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You sure it wasn't me?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It wasn't you. It was somebody else. There's somebody else aboard.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Light in those passages ain't so good.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I'm telling you, I saw somebody. I don't know who it was. But I saw somebody.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What'd he look like?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe six feet. Lanky. I didn't get a good look. He was far away. But I saw him. I saw him as sure as you're standing there.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Where's his boat, then? Where's his crew? He ain't gonna be out here by himself, that's for damn sure.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: She's so big somebody could come alongside her on the other side and we'd never know it.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe that is his boat.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Gimme a break.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If somebody's aboard her already, she ain't ours. She's theirs.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Bullshit. That boat hasn't made steam for fifty years. We found her. She's ours.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Not in the eyes of the law.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: So, we find this guy and make a deal with him.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We don't exactly have the best bargaining position.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I say fuck the motherfucker. We're a professional salvage crew going about our business. What's some yahoo doing way out here by himself anyway?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: And what do you propose? That we knock this guy off?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Why not? Why the fuck not?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Fifty million dollars. Fifty million. We gonna let this guy just take it from us? One guy?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: So we kill him?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I'm saying we gotta do whatever we gotta do to preserve our interest.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's just take it easy here, alright? Nobody's gonna kill anybody.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Supposing he wants to get bad with us?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: One guy isn't gonna be so stupid.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe he isn't alone.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I say we off-load some of that gold now.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Would you hold on just a minute here, please? Look, there's no reason to panic now. Epps saw somebody. Fine. It's a big boat.  Chances're real good he doesn't even know about the gold. If we stay cool, nobody'll be the wiser.  The gold stays where it is til we're ready to go. Like I said, it'll be a hell of a lot safer there than here.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What if that fucker finds it before we're ready to go?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll stand a watch. Four on, eight off. Low man first.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Guess that'd be me. Again.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dodge, get on that turbine. I don't care if you don't sleep for a week. The sooner you're done, the sooner we can get out of here. How's the food situation?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Pretty low all around.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll have to take it easy then. I don't think we'll find much aboard the ship, but it's probably worth looking around.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Say we run into this guy again.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If he's reasonable, maybe we can make some kind of deal. If not. We'll have to re-consider our options.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, reconsider fucking his shit up.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Pretty handy with that scatter gun, Epps. You raised on a farm?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Seen a lota movies.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: No cowboy shit up there, understand?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: No cowboy shit. Right.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Coffee.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You're a pal.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Got your light?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Smokes?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Oh yeah.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: See you boys later.  Don't be late, I need my beauty rest.

Dialogue: Murphy to Epps.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Murphy to Epps.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Epps.

Dialogue: You just shoot at something?

Dialogue: Yeah. Just a bird. Just a stupid bird.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Bodies're too fresh.

Dialogue: Fresh ain't the first word that comes to mind.

Dialogue: Greek citizen. Merchant navy.  Obviously we aren't the first to come across this ship. They probably stumbled across it just like we did.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: And look what happened.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Damn barbaric is what it is.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Could be meant as a warning.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Stay away. Or else.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Because of the gold.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That'd be my guess.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: So whoever did this might still be around.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Maybe Epps's mystery man had something to do with it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Maybe.

Dialogue: So, what? We report this? Call the Coastguard?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Let's not be too hasty.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Yeah. Hell, what difference does it make if we report it now or later? We call this in now, gonna be Coastguard, FBI, who knows who, all over the place.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dodge, if this isn't incentive enough to fix that boat, I don't know what is.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: All the seals and gaskets're shot. Anything that was rubber burned up.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Can't you use something else?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I might be able to find something on the ship. But it's gonna take time.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Do what you need to do. Just do it fast.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I need lag bolts, especially one inch standard. And sheet metal. Preferably steel, about a sixteenth of an inch. Aluminium, even tin'll do.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I ain't no mechanic, just so you know.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: You find anything that even looks like a compressor. I don't care what, grab it.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Dammit!

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Dodge?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Dodge!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Captain relieved of command.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: This is Murphy. Anybody trying to call me? Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Greer? Dodge?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Who is this?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Who is this!!

Dialogue: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Greer! Dodge!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Dodge to Murphy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Murphy.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: You better get down here quick,

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I think you better see this for yourself.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I found him like this.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Oragishlaoomnudrasadrafantoshviska getofedobrodijotosiantosg.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I'm no doctor. But I'd say he's in a coma.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I don't know what else you'd call it. He's breathing on his own, but his pupils are completely blown out. He's totally unresponsive to pain.  What happened up there?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I heard a scream. When I got there I found him on the floor. He was having some kind of seizure. I didn't see anybody else.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: He must've seen something.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Other than the obvious, there's nothing wrong with him that I can see, not on the outside.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Then what the hell happened to him?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Just before I heard him yell there was somebody on the radio.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Greer?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I don't know. No. Not Greer. Somebody.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It was a man's voice. Repeating some sort of children's rhyme. I don't know, it didn't make any sense. You didn't hear it?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Not me.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: He needs a doctor.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I'll call us in. Dodge, see how many signal flares you can scrounge up.  Keep an eye on him.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard. This is tugboat Arctic Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard, United States Coastguard. This is tugboat Arctic Warrior whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Over.

Dialogue: Mayday. Mayday. Mayday. To any vessel. This is Arctic Warrior.  Arctic Warrior. Arctic Warrior.  Whiskey alpha sierra bravo four zero niner two. Last known position one seven four west, five seven north. I am afloat and drifting.  Require immediate medical assistance for one person, possibly comatose. I am a one hundred twenty foot civilian tug, hove to at port bow of disabled passenger liner Chimera. I repeat, Chimera. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How's he doing?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Same. Any luck?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: No. I'll try again later.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: They're dead in the water that morning. Four hours later the captain's relieved of his command. And that evening they issue a general SOS.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Possibly false. Hence the IMA record of being lost at sea. I don't think mutiny's out of the question here.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: On a passenger ship in 1953?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If they knew what they were carrying.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You're saying they mutinied for the gold?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If they were close enough to shore, they probably figured they could get away in the lifeboats.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Only something must've gone wrong.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, way wrong.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: So. I got a question. Just from a, you know, purely technical standpoint. We call the Coastguard.  Coastguard shows up. What exactly is the plan?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How do you mean?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Well, they're gonna be asking a lot of questions. About us. About those bodies. About the gold. Seems like we oughta be prepared is all.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I guess the best strategy's just to tell them the truth.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Yeah, well. The truth is one thing. When there's more than a few hundred million dollars involved, that's a whole new deal.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What do you propose?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: For starters, getting that gold off the ship. What they don't know about isn't gonna bother them.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There's no way we're gonna hide a few thousand pounds of gold from the Coastguard here. Besides, it'll be safer where it is.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: With all due respect, skipper.  Part of that up there's mine. I'd kinda like to have a little say in what happens to it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Tell you what, Dodge. Once we get back to shore, you can do whatever you want with your share. But until then, the gold stays right where it is.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I think you know.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Maybe you can tell me then.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The radio!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: The radio. Oh, yeah, the radio.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Take it easy, willya? What about the radio?!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You smashed it!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Don't lie to me!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What the fuck -- ?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You didn't want us calling anybody. Too liable to ruin your big payday.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I didn't touch the fucking radio.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I didn't touch the fucking radio!  Ever occur to you there's somebody else on that boat, skipper?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Conveniently enough for you.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Look, I didn't touch it. Alright?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Jesus.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It's Greer.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Never been more thirsty in my life.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Drink up then.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: How're you feeling?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Lost my sea legs.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Any dizziness?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Headache, nausea, lights?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Lights?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Sudden flashes of light.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I feel fine.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What day is it?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I don't know. Tuesday?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Wrong. It's Friday.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Try Wednesday.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Right. Wednesday.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You don't remember?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Last thing I remember I was aboard the Chimera. Down somewhere in there scavenging around.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You've been out for about a day.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Say what?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dodge found you out cold in one of the cabins.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Oh, man.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We heard you scream. Any idea what you might've seen?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: I wish I could tell you. I'd be real interested to know myself.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The ah... the radio's out.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Somebody took it out of commission last night.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Smashed it up pretty bad.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: But, who -- ?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: The skipper seems to think I did it. That I'm more interested in that gold than my own safety or the safety of my fellow shipmates.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Did you?

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Hell no. You think I'm crazy?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Regardless of how it happened, there isn't much of a chance to fix it. The odds of another vessel in range of the walkie-talkies are almost astronomical. So, as of today, we're pretty much on our own out here.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Looks like part of the general log.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: "The crew have gone mad with greed and fight among themselves like wild dogs over fresh kill."

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: February first.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: The same day she supposedly went down.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Must not've been the captain's entry. He was probably out of the picture by then.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: "Their lacking diligence has undoubtedly caused the collision. Distress calls have been made."

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Collision? With what?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: The page's missing. Then their SOS was real.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: But where's the damage?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe the other ship took the worst of it.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If it was a ship she hit.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Dodge to Murphy!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: You better get down here right now! We're taking water! Big time!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What the hell happened!

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Turbine chamber on number two must've blown! Took out part of the hull!

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: We're not gonna be able to pump it!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Alright. Everybody grab your gear! This' is where we get off!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dodge!

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Rotten stem to stern. Guess you couldn't expect much else.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: We ain't exactly in what you'd call your high traffic neighborhood either.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The coast guard has our last position. They'll send somebody out soon enough. A ship this size you can't exactly miss.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It's a good bet they'll be asking a lot of questions when they get here too.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let 'em ask. This ship's legally ours now.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: When they find out what it's carrying, they may not be so interested in what's legal.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Maybe you shoulda thought a that before you scuttled our boat.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: The turbine blew.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Lemme see, was that before or after the oil fire?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Easy, easy.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Gettin' a little hot under the collar, I'd say.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Must be a little too the truth, eh Dodge?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I said, shut the hell up.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Both of you. I don't want to hear it again.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: So just stow it. You understand?  We don't need this right now.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Just wanted to check on our little baby.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: That oughta buy a man pretty much anything he wants.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: If money can buy what he wants.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: I don't figure there's much I want money can't buy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Then you're a lucky man.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll stand the watch on deck tonight. You're up first.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy?

Dialogue: You must leave.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: There's great evil here, more than you can know. Leave now or you may never leave.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: But --

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: My God....

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: No!!

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Yeah.  Yeah, fine.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: You'd think on a ship this size there'd be something left to eat.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: After fifty years there ain't nothin' left but shoe leather.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Tomorrow we'll see if we can't find some line and tackle. Use some of those bodies below decks for bait.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: There's a charming thought.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: We can always start shooting birds.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: What say, Epps? You up for some roasted albatross?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Looks like we're in a strong current.  Must be making almost five knots full on ass backwards.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Nasty little swell outa the north west too.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's just hope somebody sees us first out here.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's a Noaa buoy.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Government weather. It's got a transmitter aboard.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's go, let's go, let's go.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Higher. You're gonna miss it.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: We're still drifting.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The mooring hasn't come taught.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It's not gonna hold us.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Doesn't matter.

Speaker: dodge
Dialogue: No fucking way.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Damn it.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Couldn't sleep.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Wish I could say the same.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What do you think happened on this boat?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I guess that's the sixty four thousand dollar question, isn't it?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: The what?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Never mind. Before your time.  I think at least some of the crew went a little nuts. The usual stuff that happens when people stumble on a fortune. Equal parts greed and paranoia, usually resulting in homicide. What happened after that is anybody's guess. But, judging by our Greek friends down below, it doesn't look like the last time.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Are we smart enough to avoid that?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I don't know, are we?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: When you found me yesterday, at the pool. I'd seen... something.  Someone.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Not our mystery guest again.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: No. Someone else. A girl.  I'm not sure she was... real.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Not real?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What, like some kind of ghost?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I don't know what else you'd call her. One second she was there, the next she was gone.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: And I had a kind of hallucination.  There were others. I saw them in the pool. Drowning.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe hallucination is the wrong word. It was more than that. As though they were showing me.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Showing you what?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What happened.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Maybe it was one of them did the handy work on those Greeks.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: No. I think they are, were, just passengers. Innocent victims.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Victims of what?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Something bad happened here, Murphy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That much I think we've already established.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: More than just a mutiny. More than just the gold.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: She said the ship was evil. That we had to leave right away. That if we didn't, we might never leave.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Why you? How come the rest of us haven't seen these people?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Just lucky I guess.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Well. Getting off this ship's exactly what we're trying to do.  Short of that, I don't know what else to tell you.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Do me a favor and wake up Dodge. He's next on.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: And Epps?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You can tell the others about this. But, for my money, I think it's best you keep it to yourself.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Dodge.  Dodge.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Get up.

Dialogue: You're late.

Dialogue: Sorry.

Dialogue: Don't fall asleep.

Dialogue: Right.

Dialogue: Dodge.

Dialogue: This is Dodge. Over.

Dialogue: Identify yourself, motherfucker!

Dialogue: Dodge?

Dialogue: Check it out.

Dialogue: I don't even want to know what that's gonna taste like now.

Dialogue: Better than starving to death.

Dialogue: Murphy to Epps.

Dialogue: Epps, over.

Dialogue: Either of you seen Dodge?

Dialogue: Nope.

Dialogue: He's not on deck and I can't raise him on the radio.

Dialogue: He took the shotgun and a light.

Dialogue: Must've heard something below deck and went down to check it out.

Dialogue: Alright. We stay together. Nobody goes any further than earshot.

Dialogue: Murphy to Dodge. Murphy to Dodge. Over.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Murphy to Dodge. Do you copy? Over.

Dialogue: Right here.

Dialogue: Greer?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

Dialogue: Murphy?

Dialogue: Sorry. Didn't mean to scare you.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Yeah. Fine. I just thought I heard something is all.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Nothing. Let's get outa here.

Dialogue: Can't find the shotgun.

Dialogue: So whoever did this now has our shotgun.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Doesn't look like it much matters.

Dialogue: What do we do with him?

Dialogue: Leave him till we can get some help.  From now on, nobody comes down here.

Dialogue: What about the gold?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Leave it.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Now hold up just a minute. Let's be reasonable here.

Dialogue: You think whoever did this is reasonable?

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: All I'm saying is that gold's worth a lot more to us now than it ever was.

Dialogue: I can't believe you. Dodge's dead and all you can think about is cashing in your share.

Dialogue: I didn't sign up to go home empty handed. And I sure ain't gonna roll over for the freaky motherfucker did this.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Nobody's going anywhere with that gold now. Anybody tries to board, we'll know about it.  You can do what you want, Greer. But neither of us is gonna risk saving your ass down here if it comes to that.

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Fine with me.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Greer?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Greer!

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Let go!

Speaker: greer
Dialogue: Oragishlaoomnudrasadrafantoshviska getofedobrodijotosiantosg.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy! I'm on C deck, cabin 400! Get down here now!!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Smashed the radio. Scuttled the boat. Killed Dodge. Would've killed you. He's off his nut, no doubt there.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Could be a stroke. Who knows?  The general log said the crew were fighting among themselves. "Like wild dogs."

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Over the gold.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Maybe it was more than that.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: They went crazy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Crazy with greed. Not crazy. Not like him.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We lash a few of these together it might get us far enough into the shipping lanes to be rescued.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hard to say which is worse, staying here or taking our chances in open water.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: If the weather holds it might not be so bad.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's not the weather I'm worried about. The wrong current could drag us as far as the Aleutians before we come across another boat.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy, this is Epps. Do you copy?

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Who is this?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster to the crow. Where are you now? I know but won't say so."

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy. Penny whistle toy.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster to the crow. Where are you now? I know but won't say so."

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: "Cock-a-doodle-doo, said the rooster to the crow. Where are you now? I know but won't say so." Cassandra, if you insist on playing that while I read I'll just stop right now.

Speaker: the girl
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: He certainly did shorten it, didn't he?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: I thought this was all the rage.

Speaker: katie
Dialogue: Maybe last year.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: What about this year?

Speaker: katie
Dialogue: It's not your color anyway.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: I like it, daddy.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Well thank you!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Daddy, how much longer before we start moving again?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: They're working on the engines, honey. As soon as they fix them we'll be on our way.

Speaker: mutineer
Dialogue: You like that, daddy? I'll show you something else now.

Speaker: katie
Dialogue: It isn't real.

Speaker: katie
Dialogue: Many bad things have happened here. But you mustn't allow the evil inside. I tell you this because you can see me. The others can't. But you must leave. You must leave.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Epps to Murphy.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Epps to Murphy.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We hit land.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We're in an island chain. It's only a matter of time before we hit another one.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Greer's gone. He broke out of the tank.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: He's been shot.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's get the hell out of here.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It should be enough to get us to one of those islands. Gimme a hand, wouldya?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Prop it here. We need to pull these braces off. There's a hammer on the stand. There.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I'll take that.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It was you.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: You killed them.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It was only a matter of time before somebody killed somebody.  You saw it coming as well as I did. Dodge had his plans, starting with scuttling the boat. And Greer too, except he went nuts. Couldn't take it, I guess. Could've happened in the middle of downtown Anchorage. But did it make him any less dangerous? I don't think so.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: So you killed them?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The way I figure it, it was them or me. I thought putting Dodge up on that pipe was a nice touch? Bought a little time. Made it look like whoever killed those Greeks was still around. But it's just us on this ship. Us and your... spirit friends.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: And now you're gonna kill me, is that it?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I didn't want it to turn out this way.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: Murphy, don't you see what's happening?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I think I see it pretty well.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It's the ship. The ship's making you think this way.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I know a little bit about human nature and what I've seen only confirms that.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: It's a trap. There was no way we were gonna get away with that gold. Nobody ever does. It's just the bait. This ship sucks people in and it never lets them out.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I think maybe you been on this boat a little too long, with all that supernatural mumbo jumbo. There's nothing supernatural about greed. And that's what it comes down to, pure and simple.

Speaker: epps
Dialogue: I don't give a damn about the gold.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I wish I could believe that. Either way, you know what I've done. I've got no choice.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There's no reason to make this any more difficult than it has to be.
